import Mathlib

/-- If f is FrÃ©chet-differentiable at x0 with derivative `f' : E â†’L[â„] â„`, then the error
    f(x0+h) - f(x0) - f' h is bounded by the operator norm times â€–hâ€– plus an arbitrarily
    small additive factor: for every Îµ>0 there is Î´>0 such that
    |f(x0+h) - f(x0) - f' h| â‰¤ (â€–f'â€– + Îµ) * â€–hâ€– for all h with â€–hâ€– < Î´. -/

variables {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace â„ E]

theorem frechet_deriv_error_bound {f : E â†’ â„} {x0 : E} {f' : E â†’L[â„] â„}
  (hf : HasFDerivAt f f' x0) :
  âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ Î´ > 0, âˆ€ h : E, â€–hâ€– < Î´ â†’ abs (f (x0 + h) - f x0 - f' h) â‰¤ (â€–f'â€– + Îµ) * â€–hâ€– := by sorry

    |f(x0+h) - f(x0) - f' h| â‰¤ (â€–f'â€– + Îµ) * â€–hâ€– for all h with â€–hâ€– < Î´. -/

variable {E : Type _} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace â„ E]

  sorry

theorem frechet_deriv_error_bound {E : Type _} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace â„ E]
